course_title: Topics in German Studies: Fantasy Literature
class_notes: How and why does literature imagine worlds other than our own? While German culture has produced major schools of rational and scientific thought (from enlightenment philosophy to modern physics), German-language literature has also often ventured beyond scientific rationality and explored worlds of dreams, fantasy, and the supernatural. This course will focus on 'fantastic' short stories and novellas from the Romantic era to the present, and consider how authors have imagined strange, alternate worlds as a response to culture and society of their time.
course_description: Taught in German. An interdisciplinary course intended to provide in-depth study of formative elements, influences, and movements in German-speaking culture(s). May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
